title: 6-year-old shot in Houston-area apartment complex
content:
A 6-year-old Houston boy died Thursday night after being shot in the head by a bullet that came through his family's apartment wall from an adjacent unit.
The shooting at the Laguna del Sol Apartments in the 6300 block of Sierra Blanca occurred about 6:40 p.m., when the child was walking from one bedroom to the other, Harris County Sheriff's Deputy Thomas Gilliland said.
A bullet came though and hit him once in the upper head. The boy's mother was home and discovered her injured son and called authorities. The child was transported by LifeFlight to Memorial Hermann-Texas Medical Center and was pronounced dead at about 8:20 p.m.
Gilliland said five people have been detained for questioning. Two adult males and three juvenile males who apparently were in the next apartment were detained, authorities said.
"We're trying to get to the bottom of what happened and how the gun came into play," Gilliland said.
He also said the 6-year-old had a 3-year-old sibling.
Gilliland mentioned that this incident comes on the heels of recent fatalities of children who died playing with firearms. In the latest case, however, the child was doing nothing more than walking from one room to the other, Gilliland noted.
Earlier this month, an East Harris County boy was accidentally shot by his younger brother as the two were handling a gun in their home, officials said.
RELATED: Harris sheriff pleads for gun safety
Days before that, a 3-year-old died after a shooting in northwest Harris County. And a 4-year-old was killed after accidentally shooting himself with a gun reportedly found at his baby sitter's house.
